intro: Burchardia congesta, commonly known as the clustered burchardia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. Burchardia congesta is often found in association with other wetland flora and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
